cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Ocean City, Maryland
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast parallel to the Mid-Atlantic coast and expected to track inland across New Jersey and then New England toward northern Maine/Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: New Jersey coast near Cape May/central New Jersey

weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape May, NJ to Watch Hill, RI including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic coast from Delaware northward through southern and eastern New England, including Massachusetts Bay
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts 25–35 mph possible Saturday as the center passes west of Boston
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible at high tide, generally below 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Friday night–Saturday with 2–4 inches possible and localized flash-flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk across southern New England, brief waterspouts possible offshore
